metadata.title: Climate Change Research Knowledge Base
metadata.description: A collection of research papers and articles on climate change

entries.title: Global Temperature Trends and Climate Change
entries.content: Global average temperatures have risen by approximately 1.1Â°C since the pre-industrial period, with the rate of warming accelerating in recent decades. The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) reports that human activities, particularly greenhouse gas emissions from fossil fuel combustion, are the primary driver of observed climate change. This warming trend has led to significant impacts on weather patterns, sea levels, and ecosystems worldwide.

entries.title: Ocean Acidification and Marine Ecosystems
entries.content: Ocean acidification, caused by the absorption of atmospheric CO2 by seawater, has increased ocean acidity by about 30% since the Industrial Revolution. This process threatens marine ecosystems, particularly organisms that build calcium carbonate shells and skeletons, such as corals, mollusks, and certain plankton species. Research indicates that continued acidification could disrupt marine food webs and reduce biodiversity in ocean environments.

entries.title: Renewable Energy Solutions and Carbon Reduction
entries.content: Renewable energy technologies, including solar, wind, and hydroelectric power, have experienced rapid cost reductions and deployment growth. Solar photovoltaic costs have decreased by over 80% since 2010, while wind power costs have fallen by approximately 50%. These technologies are now cost-competitive with fossil fuels in many markets and represent the most viable pathway for achieving net-zero emissions by 2050.

entries.title: Climate Change Impacts on Agriculture
entries.content: Climate change poses significant challenges to global agriculture through altered precipitation patterns, increased temperatures, and extreme weather events. Crop yields are expected to decline in many regions, particularly in tropical and subtropical areas, while some northern regions may experience increased productivity. Adaptation strategies include developing drought-resistant crop varieties, implementing precision agriculture techniques, and improving water management systems.

entries.title: Carbon Pricing and Economic Policy
entries.content: Carbon pricing mechanisms, including carbon taxes and cap-and-trade systems, have been implemented in various jurisdictions to internalize the social cost of carbon emissions. Research shows that carbon pricing can effectively reduce emissions while generating revenue for climate mitigation and adaptation efforts. However, the effectiveness depends on pricing levels, coverage, and complementary policies to address distributional impacts.
